entry.title: Rustå¤‡å¿˜å½•
entry.content:
From: https://quickref.me/rust

Getting Started {.cols-3}

Hello_World.rs

Compiling and Running

Primitive types

boolBoolean (true / false)
charcharacter
f32, f6432-bits, 64-bits floats
i64, i32, i16, i8signed 16- â€¦ integers
u64, u32, u16, u8unsigned 16-bits, â€¦ integers
isizepointer-sized signed integers
usizepointer-sized unsigned integers

See: Rust Types

Formatting {.row-span-2}

Printing Styles

Variables

Comments

See: Comment

Functions

See: Functions

Rust Types {.cols-3}

Integer

Floating-Point

Boolean

Character

String Literal

See: Strings

Arrays

Multi-Dimensional Array {.row-span-2}

Mutable Array

Use the mut keyword to make it mutable.

Slices

Vectors

A vector is declared using the vec! macro.

Tuples

Rust Strings {.cols-3}

String Literal

String Object

.capacity()

Calculates the capacity of the string in bytes.

.contains()

Checks if the substring is contained inside the original string or not.

Pushing a single character

Pushing an entire String

Rust Operators {.cols-3}

Comparison Operators

e == fe is equal to f
e != fe is NOT equal to f
e < fe is less than f
e > fe is greater f
e <= fe is less than or equal to f
e >= fe is greater or equal to f

Arithmetic Operators

a + ba is added to b
a - bb is subtracted from a
a / ba is divided by b
a % bGets remainder of a by dividing with b
a * ba is multiplied with b

Bitwise Operators

OperatorDescription
g & hBinary AND
`gh`
g ^ hBinary XOR
g ~ hBinary oneâ€™s complement
g << hBinary shift left
g >> hBinary shift right

Logical Operators

ExampleMeaning
c && dBoth are true (AND)
c OR dEither is true (OR)
!cc is false (NOT)

Compound Assignment Operator

OperatorDescription
k += lAdd a value and assign, then k=9
k -= lSubstrate a value and assign, then k=18
k /= lDivide a value and assign, then k=9
k *= lMultiply a value and assign, then k=81
`k= l`

Rust Flow Control {.cols-3}

If Expression

Ifâ€¦Else Expression

Ifâ€¦Elseâ€¦ifâ€¦Else Expression

Ifâ€¦Let Expression {.row-span-3}

Match Expression {.row-span-3}

While Loop

Loop keyword

The infinite loop indicated.

Break Statement

Rust Functions {.cols-3}

Basic function

Pass by Value

Pass by Reference

Returns

Arrays as Arguments

Returning Arrays

Misc {.cols-3}

Type Casting

To perform type-casting in Rust one must use the as keyword.

Borrowing

Here borrowed value borrows the value from value one using & operator.

De-referencing

De-referencing in rust can be done using the * operator

Variable Scope

This will produce error as the scope of the variable a_number ends at the braces

Also see

  • The Rust Document (doc.rust-lang.org)
  • The Rust Reference (doc.rust-lang.org)
  • Rust Cheatsheet (phaiax.github.io)
